Our History

  • 1946

    The orginisation is formed

    Judy Fryd (31 October 1909 – October 2000) a mother of a daughter, Felicity, born with a learning disability, formed 'The National Association of Parents of Backward Children' - which later became Mencap.

  • 1955

    Elsie and Thomas Baker establish ‘Association of Parents of Backward Children’.

  • 1955

    Mrs Elsie Ness (Jean Rigden’s mother) joins the Association

  • ????

    The Baker family are honoured

    The Baker family were honoured at a presentation at Walton Leigh (school?). At the presentation were Mrs Elsie Baker, Miss Joyce Baker, Mrs Elsie Ness (Jean’s mother) and Mr Thomas Baker.

  • Circa 1965

    Burview Hall (prefabricated) opened

    1st Burview Hall (prefabricated) opened for ‘Walton & Weybridge Society for Mentally Handicapped Children’ on Walton Charities land next to Ellesmere Hospital’s entrance. It cost £5,500 and was formally opened by Mrs “Bunty” Haigh of St Martin’s School (in Rydens Road). Seventy parents and guests attended. Mr Thomas Baker (of Garrick Close) was the chairman or secretary.

We help enrich the lives of all people with learning disabilities.
